description.narrative: Specific positive developmental impacts are expected to be: (i) Strengthen the capital base and adequacy of a systemically important bank in Romania, and do so in a more efficient manor than raising Tier I capital. In light of the difficult economic context, a strong capital base is very important, not only because it will reduce the solvency risk for the Bank, but it allow the Bank to consolidate its position on the market. (ii) Allow the Bank to continue to grow its loan portfolio. In the absence of this investment, the Bank could be required to reduce its loan portfolio growth, reduce its exposure to riskier asset classes or increase Tier I capital, which would be costly at this stage. (iii) Demonstrate the ability of a domestic Romanian bank to attract investments from international investors in difficult financial times; and bolster depositors'' confidence in the banking sector of Romania by signaling IFIs'' continuing support and commitment to the Romanian banking sector.

The proposed project comprises an IFC investment in a subordinated convertible bond to be issued by Banca Transilvania S.A. (BT or the Bank) a long standing client of IFC. BT is the third largest bank in Romania with total assets of EUR6 billion, equity of EUR537 million, and net income of EUR54 million as of the end of December 2011. This new IFC investment is aimed at supporting a bank committed to fulfill the funding needs and is designed to strengthen the Banks capitalization.
